page.title: 14TRANSPORT IN BURSCOUGH 1
page.content:
ROADS
Burscough village is strung out along the A59 for over a mile. The original Burscough is at the southern end. With the arrival of the canal in 1846 and the railway shortly after, Burscough Bridge grew up around it's familiar 2 bridges. Transport through the village today is mainly road vehicles. The Liverpool to Preston road (via Ormskirk) passes through Burscough carrying a heavy load of traffic. In 10 minutes, one Tuesday morning, we counted:110 cars,23 vans,11 lorries,1 bike and 1 tractor. There were no buses because of a national bus strike.
Railways page 16 Canals page 17
